FWIW, I use J.B.'s methodology, /and/ I like to fit all of my tests for
a given class into a single TestCase. I find that in a multi-developer
environment, it's simply too difficult for everyone to keep track of
where every test for a given class is located if the tests are scattered.

In my primary TestCase (J.B.'s 'ATest' class), the suite()
implementation adds the test suites of all the interface-specific tests, so

public static Test suite() {
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite(ATest.class);
suite.addTestSuite(AAsXTest.suite());
suite.addTestSuite(AAsYTest.suite());
suite.addTestSuite(AAsZTest.suite());
return suite;
}

I also implement each of the '...As...Test' classes as static inner
classes of my main TestCase.
